title: Part a. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For indicating that the equation for gravitational force is applicable

title: Part b. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

1 point: For drawing a straight line from the original to a distance R, and not going past R

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

4 points

1 point: For drawing a straight line from the original to a distance R, and not going past R

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis

The student response earns one of the following points:

4 points

1 point: For drawing a straight line from the original to a distance R, and not going past R

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis

The student response earns three of the following points:

4 points

1 point: For drawing a straight line from the original to a distance R, and not going past R

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point: For having the maximum magnitude occur at R

1 point: For having the curve from R to 5R decreasing in magnitude with proper curvature and appearing to reach an asymptote

1 point: For recognizing that the force is always negative, i.e., the graph is always below the x-axis

title: Part c. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

In this and all subsequent parts, either C or 4 3 πGρm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca aI0aaabaGaaG4maaaacqaHapaCcaWGhbGaeqyWdiNaamyBaaaa@3CBC@ could be used.

title: Part e. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

1 point: For indicating that the ball will move from the center to the surface of the planet

1 point: For indicating that the ball will stop at the surface, return to the center, and continue oscillating in this manner, with no damping

Describing the motion as simple harmonic oscillation with no damping earned full credit.

F=ma Cr=m d 2 r d t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGgb Gaeyypa0JaamyBaiaadggaaeaacaWGdbGaamOCaiabg2da9iaad2ga daWcaaqaaiaadsgadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaGccaWGYbaabaGaam izaiaadshadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaaaaaaaaa@430B@

Alternately, one could relate the time to the period of oscillation, T=2π 3 4πGρ , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamivaiabg2 da9iaaikdacqaHapaCdaGcaaqaamaalaaabaGaaG4maaqaaiaaisda cqaHapaCcaWGhbGaeqyWdihaaaWcbeaakiaacYcaaaa@40F7@ i.e., the time is one-fourth this period. The above equation was required; a more genberal form was not acceptable.
